intro: Lastrea tussacii, commonly known as the Tussacii Lastrea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
